page.title: 16Headcorn Airfield
page.content: Shenley Farm incorporates a private airfield with a grass runway, used during the 1939-45 war as a forward fighter base, now developed into a complex with flying school, pleasure flights, parachute club and landing facilities for local businesses. A comprehensive RAF war museum is on the site and the HQ of the local Air Training Corps for teenage boys is located here. At weekends the airfield is packed with visitors enjoying the sights and sounds of the busy little airfield. There have been complaints from some local residents but all activities are strictly controlled. On summer evenings the distinctive drone of the parachute plane high in the sky makes one look up to see tiny dots fall from the plane to become billowing chutes carrying people gently to earth.
